text: We have stayed in most of the Satori villas, and this time spent our days in Villa Siri.  A perfect couple’s villa.  Once again the staff were fantastic, and we enjoyed the same beautiful outlook as the other villas.  Our neighbours were a farmer planting his rice paddies and a cute nursery of ducklings.  There are so many local spots to be enjoyed, and many great restaurants nearby,  There are few places in Ubud that are so close to town but feel so far away.  Absolutely the best location and villa experience you will get in Ubud.  Loved it.
title: Different Villa, Same Five Star Experience

owner_response.text: Thank you for being a part of the Satori family, and it is our pleasure to host you!  the authentic Balinese experience is right outside your door, with traditional village life, rice planting, and our quacky neighbors for a window into Bali's fascinating world. It is easy to walk into vibrant Ubud center within about 10 minutes, but there are 13 restaurants and warnings, painters galleries, yoga, spas and fresh coconuts with 3 minutes...you never have to leave our lovely location unless you choose to!  Relaxing and serene, Satori Villas are the perfect antidote to hustle and bustle, and our stellar staff will spoil you in every way.  All the best from all of us, and we look forward to your next visit!

text:

text:
We stayed as a family of 3 in August. After 20 hrs of travel from the UK we were feeling a little jaded. This changed as soon as we jumped on the back of a couple of mopeds and were whisked skillfully through the streets and paddy fields to Satori Villas. We actually stayed in the villa named Satori. A 3 bed private pool villa. We were given a phone that we could contact the staff at anytime. 
Breakfast was ordered and arranged the day before and each morning we came downstairs to a glorious breakfast spread set up on the terrace overlooking the pool and paddy fields.
This setting of this place is truly breath taking. just a few minutes away from the bustle of Ubud yet it felt so tranquil.
Can't recommend this place highly enough. Wayan and her team were efficient and friendly.

text: We - three couples - spent 4 days at this perfectly placed and thoughtfully fit out villa, including the annual Nyepi celebration of 24 hours of silence when the island of Bali shuts down - I wanted more! The villa is serenely set high among the scenic rice paddies just a 10 min walk to the heart of bustling Ubud. It is spacious and well appointed with nothing left not thought through from comfortable bedding, yoga mats, pool towels, a full kitchen, pool and pool guest house, the ability to open up the house to the breeze or if needed because lets face it, it is on the equator and it does get hot - air conditioning in every room (including the living area if you need).  The wifi is fast for those that need to stay connected. While it is set among the rice paddies, there is a community here with artists and restaurants (Sweet Orange!) for the finding. The walk down to the main road takes you through a local neighborhood with plenty of shops and restaurants that are a quiet break from what is going just 50m away. For anyone with walking issue, the villa staff will provide transport down and back up. The villa staff - Wayan and Ketut especially who have been there for a decade are quick to see to every comfort and much is anticipated - there are umbrellas and flash lights and yes, bug spray as well as a local cell with everyone's numbers including Gede, the driver - so you are always connected if you need.  Really, we cannot say enough about the location, the villa and the hospitality of Kasey and her team. If you like the photos on the website, you will fall in love with it in person. We very much plan on being repeaters.
title: Bali as you imagined it

text:
We have been visiting Bali for over 30 years and have stayed in a variety of accommodation including the 2 Four Seasons Hotels and the Amandari Hotel. When we arrived at Satori Villas we were stunned by the amazing views over a large expanse of rice fields. Never before had we had such a wonderful outlook and it continued to delight us for the duration of our two week stay. What we loved about Satori Villas is that we felt in touch with the authentic Bali and it's beautiful people. 

The staff were superb and at the end of our stay we felt sad to say goodbye. They greeted us with big smiles each morning, happily made us delicious breakfasts and were readily available if we had any needs or requests during the day. They took us to and from the centre of Ubud on motorcycles whenever we asked but mostly we liked to walk the short and fascinating small road ourselves. By the end of the two weeks we got to know several of the locals and it was great to stop and have a chat (despite our limited Indonesian vocabulary).

The Villa was expansive, extremely comfortable and with many areas to relax - both inside and out. It was filled with Balinese art and furnishings and surrounded by a fabulous tropical garden. 

For us our stay at Satori Villas was a perfect combination of luxury and an authentic Balinese experience - we can highly recommend it if you are planning to visit Ubud.
title: Fabulous and luxurious stay in one of Bali's most beautiful settings.

text:
Our home-away-from-home. For about the last year and a half, we have been living part-time in Bali and Satori Villas has been our home-away-from-home. We have stayed in 2 BR Serena, 3BR Solera and 3BR Santana each for a several months at a time. We stayed in 1BR Siri for a few days.

They are all great, beautifully located in the rice fields with great views, good breezes, nice pools, and an attentive and lovely staff. Maybe the best thing is that Satori Villas are located right on a lovely rice field walk, and only a 10 min walk (or 3 min scooter ride) to town. They are a bit elevated from town, so it is noticeably cooler and breezier. And quieter – serene, really. I sleep great here.

The paved path is really nice for my morning walk. Every day I say hello to Nyoman the Coconut man, Wyann the artist, a series of people working in the rice fields, the art-shop owner at the front door, and the staff at a few restaurants along the way. Often I get a nice look at Mt. Agung or some of the other cinder cones in the distance. The wonderful Sweet Orange restaurant (5 stars on TA), right in the rice fields, is a 10 min walk. And all a 10 min walk from whatever stores you want in town – without the congestion.

As to the villas themselves…

All are well-built with good internet, good kitchens, and good electricity. 3BR Solera is great if you have guests because there are two levels, each with its own living room. Great veranda with dining table for al fresco meals or watching the rain (more in the winter). 2BR Serena is right-sized for the two of us, the pool doesn’t get much sun (which is what we like). Dining table is outside next to the pool and a great balcony with expansive views just outside the bedrooms upstairs. 3BR Santana has a wonderful open layout, a LR inside and nice chairs & couch outside as well, next to the pool. The views are more expansive here because it’s on the end.

You can’t go wrong staying at Satori Villas. They are wonderful!
title: Our home-away-from-home !

text:
1. The staff at Satori’s Banana Villa — Wayan, her husband Ketut and Putu — are thoughtful, warm, dedicated, thorough, professional and super-likable. At the end of our second visit, they felt so nearly like family that it was hard to say goodbye.
2. The breakfasts were exceptional! Waking up to fresh-cut fruit AND a fresh fruit smoothie spoiled us. That these were followed by hot, fluffy, mildly spicy nasi goreng….? Heavenly way to start a day.
3 . The setting, among rice paddies and palms, is so beautiful. You can point a camera in any direction and capture beauty. The pool and the well-tended landscaping (and the aforementioned rice paddy just beyond) make a feast for the eyes and an idyllic scene to really relax in. You feel privacy yet also an unconstrained openness . (The rooms’ semi-outdoor showers provide the same paradoxical vibe.)
4. Banana Villa is beautifully decorated with original art by the cream of (I think) local artists and handsome, comfortable, inviting furniture. Wife and I loved ending our eves in the ultra-cozy TV room.

5. It’s a brief walk to the elegant and un-toppable Luxe Grill for dinner!

text: Spent 4 amazing months(2022 january-2022.may)in Villa Banana. We tried a lot of villa in Asia, but it was the best ever. Its not a trendy design villa but instead its an amazing house  where you can feel like at home! The decoration, the furnishing, the home appliances etc.are so well-thought-out. You can open the windows and sliding doors everywhere so the whole house is airy and bright. The decent size pool facing to ricefields in a beatiful garden, with 4 comfy sunbeds  and 2 parasols. It is a huge roofed outdoor area with table for six people and a lounge area too, with fans, so you can spend your time outdoor even in tropical rain. Every room has aircon and fan too. We didnt used aircon much(only in bedroom in the  evening), if you open every door, tropizal breeze go through the house. The kitchen is fully equipped,has everything what you need to cook/bake. The beds are extreme comfy. Every room has an own outdoor bathroom, but its roofed so you can use it in bad weather too.Water pressure is excellent.The toilet is special(septic system), so you cannot throw the toilet paper in it, you must throw in a dustbin,the staff empty it daily. The cleanness is top, it was cleaning 2 times per week, and it was really accurate with detergents, so its not the ordinary asian quality. The location is excellent. You can reach the villa only on foot or by scooter, but its only 5 minutes from the road where you can rent parking lot for your car or get a grab. And its 10min on foot from Ubud Palace. Bugs and wildlife: the villa is on the ricefileds but there was no problem(if you keep in my that you are in Bali…) No rats,no cockroach,no rooster. There were gekkos and ducks and ants,and a few dogs but these dogs are pets not stray dogs. There was only a few mosquito. The villa is ideal for families or friends, but we really enjoyed that we were only two of us in the whole house, so its ideal for couples too. And the staff: Ketut and his wife Wayan lives next to the villa. They make everything, cleaning, gardening, pool maintenance etc., and they can help if you have any question or must organize something. They were really kind and helpful, polite, and made everything so, to disturb us least. So we like to thank for Ketut and Wayan their work, and for the Owner and Management that they dreamed and built a villa that perfect for everybody who want a home away from home. The photos cant present the villa well enough, so i’ve uploaded a walk trough  video on you tube (search: Villa Banana(Satori Villas Ubud) walk trough). Absolutely 5* !!Hope we can back soon…
title: Villa Banana, the heaven itself

text:
Words will never do this villa and indeed, it's local area, justice. I would describe our time as an "experience", rather than a holiday! 

Located in a car-free section north of the Ubud hubbub, it's a mere 6-7 minute walk to Jl. Ubud, yet surrounded by "real" Bali - something all but gone from the western coastal areas. A scooter is optional, but it sure makes it fun! :)

The staff are charming and plentiful, to say the least and nothing is a problem. Ask Komang's Dad for a fresh coconut ... just awesome :)

Kasey and Rico's visitor guide was the most comprehensive I've ever seen and we sampled many of its suggestions - breakfasts at Milk & Madu and Kafe, walks through the rice paddies and up along the Ridge, local dinners at Samara, one of the best pizzas we've tasted from the local Italian (home delivered in a tropical downpour) and the pinnacle of our dining - the Luxe (do NOT miss this!). Did I mention yoga at the Yoga House?. 

We are already planning a return trip - next time will have to be longer than our painfully short, three nights.

We highly recommend these villas.
title: The ultimate Bali holiday destination

text: We stayed at Villa Satori (yes there is a villa named after its business name) at Satori Villas. We didn't utilize the extra guesthouse since we only had 4 people, but this was the only unit available during the time we visited and we are very glad we stayed there (and will stay again next time). Very comfortable, luxurious accommodations, with plenty of space, air conditioning, a beautiful private pool, and amazing views from the outdoor dining patio and master bedroom balcony. We did not see anyone else other than our villa staff while we were on the property, even though I know the other villas were booked. And the location is very quiet and peaceful (other than sounds of nature). It was rejuvenating to wake up every morning to a breathtaking sunrise, and the distant sounds of crickets, crowing roosters, and quacking ducks. Our villa was huge (and we checked out but did not use the guest house, which was beautiful too). Gorgeous, well-sized pool with a lot of privacy. Since this was our first trip to Bali, we were gone most of the day sightseeing and so did not spend a ton of time in the villa except in the evenings. It would make a very restful and relaxing vacation to stay and spend time lounging around the next time we visit Bali (with more pool time and massages, etc.). The staff is what makes Satori Villas really special. Incredibly helpful and kind, with delicious breakfasts made to order each morning. They helped us arrange laundry service (and everything came back clean and neatly folded), and also had (per our request) fresh, chilled coconuts waiting for us in the fridge to enjoy after a long day out. Sure, the lodging is lovely and the location private and quiet, but it's the staff that makes it stand out. Regarding some of the negative reviews, yes - it's a tropical location and in the middle of a rice paddy, so lots of flying insects at nighttime, only if you're outside or have your windows open then. None during the day, and very few mosquitos (I don't think we ever saw one indoors), so they must be managing those pretty well. We did see a few (3 over 4 days) small geckos inside the villa, on the walls (to be expected in a tropical location), and had no issues with them whatsoever. For those familiar with staying in Hawaii, it's similar in that sense with the geckos and insects, which are not related to cleanliness, etc. As for the location, it would be challenging for folks with mobility issues to walk between the city to the villas (it's a 10-min walk with a climb), but we enjoyed the peaceful walk. And our teen boys loved the scooter rides, which were fast and fun (and the staff very skilled and safe). We typically preferred to take the beautiful walk most of the time though. Again, it really was the wonderful staff who made our visit extraordinary - Wayan welcomed us warmly and made delicious breakfasts. She helped arrange laundry and was resourceful with our many questions (and the free cellphone provided came in very handy). Ketut was kind and helpful with our belongings and an expert scooter driver, Wayan Vera was cheerful and also made us delicious breakfasts. We hope to be back again soon.
title: Exceptional staff and service, beautiful location, luxury amenities

text:
Coming back to Villa Siri is like stepping into Eden - I immediately relax and stay so for my entire time there.  Thank you again to the fabulous team that make a stay so special - Komang your smile only seems to get bigger and bigger - let alone the lovey villa.  For those that have never stayed - don't hesitate to book - the pictures on the website and here do not do it justice, no comments can either - but will try.  Look at the website.

LOCATION:  Part of what makes Satoria Villas/Villa Siri special is the location in the rice fields away from the total madness of Ubud main area.   Only scooters are allowed on the walkways for the last few hundred meters.  Therefore traffic noise is minimal.   And you can either make the walk, or phone the staff to come and collect you from the street, or run you down.  I have never used that service (apart from arrival and departure) - as I love the walk up and down - there is a little bit of a rise in one area - but nothing you need any fitness training for.

COCONUTS:  On the walk to the Villa you will find a great fresh coconut stand which Komang parents owns.  Best fresh coconut on the island - and Nyoman is lovely enough to deliver to the villa (and that was daily).  Cold coconut juice - can't beat it!

VILLA:  I love Siri - bedroom/bathroom downstairs, living / kitchen balcony upstairs - perfect to watch the rice grown, ducks waddle and cow graze.   Has its own small pool (think the others have larger ones) which is under cover so always cold.

PHONE:  You are provided with a local phone on arrival to contact the staff if needed.

FOOD:  The breakfast is lovely.  Great choice and served when you want it.  Due to my schedule I usually just get fruit and smoothie left in the fridge - but the days I had a proper breakfast were lovely.    Full cooking facilities if needed - but why........ so many great places nearby and the staff will cook a meal for you (if 2+).

CLEANLINESS:  Never stayed in a placed that is so clean.  The staff come in every day and linen to changed every 3/4 days.  Yes there are a few of the usual tropical ants that are around if you do not clean something up.

WATER:   You can now drink the tap water here - which is great (and not usual for Bali).    Also cheap and easy to buy anywhere if you are out and about, but suggest you bring your own water bottle and fill up.

LAUNDRY:  You don't need to bring a lot of clothes as local laundry which the staff will arrange to have done is cheap and quick.  Just don't put any 'quality' clothes in - hand wash those yourselves.

LOCAL DINNING:   Luxe about 2 minutes walk about is a great place for high end quality food - the Calamari is the best I have had anywhere in the world.    Sweet Orange Warung is a local place serving basic cheap hugely tasty food - try the mixed entree platter to get you started.  Then so many places in Ubud itself..........

YOGO:  My go to is Ubud Yoga House, easy walk via the town or the rice fields (weather dependent).  Highly recommend it.

AIRPORT TRANSFERS:  Book through Satori - if you didn't know where you were coming to the first time it might be confusing.  This way easy and cheap.  Is about 1.5 hours travel time from Airport.

TIP:  If you have a late evening/afternoon departure - book that night as well - as then you can shower just before you leave for the airport etc.
title: Fabulous as usual - should be a rating above excellent.

text: My absolute favorite place to stay in Ubud! Villa Satori has the friendliest staff and the most beautiful views of the rice fields! I love the pool area so much and recommend watching the sunrise there in the early morning. Breakfast is delicious and comes with a fresh smoothie. I enjoyed walking into town in the afternoon-(although the staff will drop you by motorbike if you wish). Downtown Ubud is busy and often noisey so it's nice to be nestled in the rice fields where it is quiet. There are many cute shops along the Villa's street that have similar items the market does but at a cheaper price FYI. It was so lovely to shop locally and then return for a dip in the gorgeous pool to cool off! So private and relaxing. We took several day trips with driver Gede- he was very friendly and answered any/all questions we had about the area as well as curious cultural questions. We took a jewelry making class and visited a beautiful waterfall all near Ubud. We also took a cooking class at D'charik Warung about a 5-minute walk from the Villa through the rice fields! It was one of the highlights of our trip and so nice to be walking distance to such a fun class. Ubud has so many food options but it was easy for us to find the absolute best spots based on the restaurant recommendations in the Villa's guide. This is my second time staying with Satori Villas and I can't wait to go back :)
title: My favorite place to stay in Ubud (Villa Banana)

text:
I wholeheartedly recommend Satori villas to anyone planning a trip to Ubud. It is a special place, and at this point it may be still a “hidden gem” but I can’t imagine it will stay hidden much longer!

My mother and sister joined me here for 4 blissful nights in Villa Serena, and knowing what we know now, we will book for longer next time!  So, a few highlights

The Villa itself is stunningly decorated with Balinese art, and was equipped with everything we needed for a comfortable holiday (including the well-stocked minibar with local treats, beers and wines). They have a special filter system which means you can drink the tap water - a rare luxury in Bali. Beds and high quality linens were very comfortable, and yes they have mosquito nets (good for my nervous mother) but I think I only saw like one mosquito during my entire stay. The private outdoor pool area was great for relaxing after a hot day, and the surrounding garden is lush and vibrant and helps to make the space feel very private. 

The location is 400m off of Jalan Kajeng along a rice paddy trail. What this means is that the villa feels surrounded by nature and peace among the paddies, while in reality Ubud central is only a short walk away... Though instead of walking we usually had the staff drop us to one of the main streets by motorbike. We were nervous at first but quickly came to look forward to these short thrill rides!

Among the paddies themselves we had easy access to 2 or 3 restaurants within 5 minutes walking distance. We really enjoyed our dinner at nearby Luxe grille. 

There was a useful information book in the villa, which gives loads of information on activities and restaurants, in addition to introducing some aspects of Balinese culture and customs (and how not to act a fool by pointing with your index finger!). We really appreciated that information and enjoyed reading it. I can confirm that the restaurant recommendations we tried were top notch.

Right from the start the staff treated us with such kindness. They were some of the most warm hearted people we met in Bali, and they would go above and beyond to meet any request. 
This includes Gede, their main driver. We felt very privileged to spend two days touring with him. He has much local expertise, and is honest and kind. He knows the off-the-beaten-path spots, the best lunch stopovers, and he knew just where to get the good quality woodcarving I was after. 

We stayed there only a week ago and everyday since leaving we have reminisced about how wonderful it was. This may actually be my favourite place I’ve ever stayed. Thanks to everyone at the villas for making it so special for us.
title: Pure bliss in the heart of Ubud

Four  nights seemed to go nowhere and we are already looking forward to returning early next year. For us, there is nowhere better to stay in Ubud.

text:
There are so many choices in Ubud, but this was certainly a great one. We really liked the location in the rice fields but 5 minutes from the hussle and bustle. The villas are individual and private.The staff really make it, they provide you a mobile phone and were there in an instant to take us to / from town. Vera prepared a fab breakfast to order daily, and we had a bespoke meal in one evening in which was superb. Probably the most relaxed i have been in a long time.  

Just beware for some the fact its a 10 minute walk from the main road to the Palace / Starbucks. The path is concrete / tarmacked so easy to walk with a few shops, warangs and stalls on the way. The staff provide a free transfer by moped for your during your stay and deal with your bags so its not an issue and you call using the mobile they provide. Useful for booking restaurants etc also, or calling your driver. 

Laundry was incredibly cheap and wonderfully done same day ironed etc. No downsides apart from ducks waking you early in the rice fields!
title: superb choice, a relaxing and luxurious stay in the rice fields

text:
We recently spent 4 nights in Villa Banana at Satori and we were so impressed. A huge, spacious villa with big bedrooms and plenty of space, really comfortable pillows and beds. Huge dining/living area, plus entertainment room. Lovely outdoor bathrooms. The outdoor area was great for socialising as we had friends and family staying in other villas at Satori. The pool at Villa Banana is a good size. Wayan and Ketut were amazing and their service was faultless. Every morning Wayan would come and cook us a delicious breakfast, complete with fruit platters and smoothies, fresh coffee and tea. Wayan cooked us a beautiful Indonesian meal one night. 

We loved the area, away from the hustle and bustle of the main street. The last 100 metres or so can't be reached by car but Wayan and Ketut would just come and collect us or drop us into town on their scooters when we needed, my kids loved this adventure! We walked into town a couple of times as that is downhill, we did walk up it once and it's manageable but does make for a hot walk!

I honestly couldn't fault a single thing about the accommodation or the service. I'd love to stay here again but this time I'd stay a week so I could have some more pool time!
title: Fabulous property

owner_response.text:
We are all so proud and happy to read your perfect review!  Our dedicated staff take great pride in providing intuitive and gracious guest services, and we truly enjoy sharing our beautiful Satori oasis with our guests. As you mentioned, our location is in a Green Zone, and cars are not allowed the last 100 metres. text:
What better way to end a 10-day Bali/Lombok holiday than taking a last late-night swim in your private pool surrounded by tropical plants after walking back from dinner at one of Ubud's many great restaurants? 
Villa Satori is a large part of the reason my wife and I keep returning to this part of Bali. We've stayed elsewhere in Ubud over the years, but for us, nowhere has come close.
Surrounded by rice paddies at the start of the Juwuk Manis walk, Satori is in a prize location close to the centre of town but a world away from the traffic mayhem of the main drag.
The beautifully decorated villa just has a wonderful relaxed feel to it, with an upstairs master bedroom opening onto a deck with views to Mt Agung. It's a great spot for an afternoon massage (Ask the staff to contact Wayan Shanty).
Downstairs is the kitchen and lounge, which also opens onto a covered outdoor breakfast area overlooking the gardens, pool and quest house (A free standing one-bedroom 'villa' facing onto the pool).
The villa  is well maintained and spotlessly clean. The staff,  Wayan, Ketut and Vera, are all awesome. They will happily ferry you to the main road on a scooter if you can't face the walk into town. Breakfast is provided but the staff will cook other meals on request. 
The whole Villa Satori experience is impossible to fault.
We're already planning our next stay and can't wait for another after-dinner dip in that magical pool.
title: Paradise in the rice paddies

We will see you again very soon, with great pleasure to welcome you back to your home in Ubud.

photos.caption: Beautiful villa with a Balinese vibe

text:
If you want to be off the main drag, overlooking rice fields, yet close to some shops, cafes and local life, Satori Villas are a great choice. We stayed in Villa Serena (2 bed) and Villa Satori (3 bed). Both are stunning and beautifully appointed with everything you could want. The staff are typical of the absolutely lovely Ubud people. Nothing is too much trouble for them, they are patient, hard working and always smiling. 

Villa Serena, as the name suggests, is a little more serene, being slightly further from the scooters zooming up and down the laneway that leads to Ubud. Indoors, Serena has a lovely airy spacious feel, with a large shared balcony overlooking the rice fields - fabulous for massages with a backdrop of bird sounds and water flowing over the pool's infinity edge. 

Villa Satori would be ideal for a family with 2 children and perhaps grandparents who can stay in the charming guesthouse on the opposite side of the huge pool, away from the lane. The main bedroom is exquisite with large ensuite, balcony and jacuzzi, overlooking the beautiful garden and rice fields beyond. The twin bedroom closer to the lane would be great for kids. 

Especially charming were the ducks waddling around in the field next to Villa Satori, walks through the fields to meet the locals, and the 'coconut man', stationed on the lane very close to the villas. He will climb a tree to grab you a fresh coconut and chop it open for you. 
 
It's worth foregoing total privacy to have the lovely staff visit with the traditional Bali Hindu offerings and taking care of your every need. And while you do need to walk or take a scooter ride into the town, it means your surroundings are free of cars!
title: Live in luxury surrounded by local colour

owner_response.text: Thank you for your lovely review, and the title that perfectly sums up the Satori Experience. Living in luxury, surrounded by local colour:  our gracious villas are decorated with a combination of fine Western amenities, comfortable seating and Balinese art and antiques. Outside the villas are friendly locals, ducks playing in the rice fields, and gentle water sounds. Total privacy is yours if you wish, and our sweet staff will welcome your interest in daily life and offerings.  We look forward to welcoming you back in the future!

I stayed in Satori’s Villa Banana with a group of friends just after New Year. The villa is huge, well appointed and spotlessly clean. All the bedrooms have their own lovely bathroom. 

The pool and outdoor area is amazing with beautiful views of the rice paddy fields.

Wayan and Ketut were on-site to help us with everything, including lifts down the road so we didn’t have to walk as far. Wayan also makes a lovely breakfast.

They organised yoga, massages and facials at the villa which was quite special (and didn’t cost much at all).

I’d highly recommend this villa for a family or group of friends. It’s about a 10 min walk into central Ubud and only taxi bikes are permitted to the door. Worth bearing in mind if any of your group isn’t so mobile.

text: We had a fantastic 3 night stay in Villa Serena (2 bedroom). The staff were extremely accommodating, they happily picked us up/dropped us off by scooter to town (although the walk really is lovely and not all that far). The location is spectacular and you really do feel a world away from it all. The villa is huge with your own yard and pool (see the rest of my post though), so if it’s space you are after then this is the place for you! The drawback for us with this particular villa (I think Serena is the only one) was that the staff quarters were attached to it - within our yard. This meant it never really felt private, which was one of the main reasons we booked a villa. Our gate was left open all day for staff to come and go. On one day another guest even came into our yard looking for the staff. The rest of the stay was amazing, so I guess it just depends on how important privacy in a villa is to you.
title: Amazing villa in a fabulous location

In the future we will make sure the front gate of Serena is closed at all times and review other ways so it will feel more private.  All the best to you and your family from all of us!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
From the moment I arrived at Banana Villa I felt I could stay in paradise forever.  My family of three and I stayed a wonderful week and it’s etched  in my mind for a lifetime. Some of my favorite memories are getting up before the rest of the family and listening to the local morning sounds of roosters in the distance and the calls of the birds in the Plumaria tree near the pool. There was time for yoga by the pool and quiet reflection before Wayan would arrive to open the sliding glass doors for the day. She would then effortlessly prepare my fruit smoothie made from banana and dragon fruit and then begin a beautiful breakfast to our specifications.  
We found so much to do close by.  The beautiful rice field walk is just outside the door and we walked to the Pyramid Sound Healing from there.  We found walking to town charming and would often stop five minutes down the path for a massage or foot rub just to start the day! Continuing down the lane to what we called ‘our street’  we met each and every vendor and bought fabric, clothing, hats, robes and even had custom made cushion covers made.
For evening entertainment and restaurants The welcome notes are invaluable, but one of the best meals was right at the Villa. 
We were there when it rained each day and so we’d take the Villas umbrellas and off we’d go   The shopping in Ubud is so much fun and if we’d have too many packages to carry we’d just call Ketut on the phone the villa provides, and he’d meet us in minutes on his bike and take our packages home for us.  
The Villa’s driver, Gede,  took us for a day trip for a water temple experience. Gede is very knowledge about all things  Bali and we asked questions about everything from architecture to rituals.  
We even had Wayan arrange for a beautiful young local dancer come and dance for us. She showed my daughter how to apply the dancer’s make up and some of the eye and neck movements. The Balinese dancing is amazing to see so up close and Putri is a young, beautiful, totally proficient dancer.  We loved it and made arrangements to go to the  dining and dancing at the Lotus Cafe which is just a quick right turn after going down our street. Everything is so close by.  
But if you want to stay and enjoy pure bliss,  just have the staff arrange for a massage at the Villa.  You can swim and relax while waiting for the massage tables to be set up and right there in perfect Banana Villa you can drift into nirvana. 

We’re already planning our next trip back !
title: Perfect Family Vacation

owner_response.text:
We are so happy that your Satori Villas Bali stay was relaxing and stress free!  Our goal is for you to enjoy the villas, and we will take care of all the details.  We can provide all the busy activities, or you can relax and do nothing at all.  Indulge in ultimate in-villa massages and facials, and take in the cultural sights with a side of shopping!  Highly recommended is our special up close encounter with our private dancer, who will train you in makeup, dance movements and the beautiful side to side eyes!

Our staff will be happy to pick you up or take you to Starbucks or Ubud Central Parking any time, and you will be given a Bali cell phone to contact staff.  We hope to welcome you and your family back again in the near future!  Thank you again.

text:

title: A Perfect Vacation!

owner_response.text: Thank you for the perfect review--this is what we all strive for!  Your family was full of life and a lot of fun to host--ready for anything and so interested in the unique Bali culture.  Your interest and enthusiasm makes your visit so much more special, as you understand some of the rituals that make Bali Hinduism so special!  Walking into town along our street lined with shops, galleries is a special experience, and you will meet the locals and see their wares.  Stop in at Threads of Life, grab a bite at Savannah Moon, then have a coffee at Starbucks.  It is all at your fingertips, but the villas are far enough away from the bustle of Ubud to be quiet and serene!  We look forwrad to your return in May!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Staying at Satori Villas was an incredible experience. We stayed in Banana Villa, but were given a tour of the other villas by the owners who are very kind and generous. They are all very impressive, and spacious. Banana Villa is much larger then it seems in the photos. The breakfast is delicious and the turn down service is timely. The walk into the main street in Ubud is lined with coffee shops and boutiques and wonderful massage boutiques. The food in Ubud is really impressive, specifically the Italian Place walking  7 min from the villa. The Pool at Banana is always cool during the hot days and is such a refreshing way to cool down. The viewThe Villa is only 45 min from the airport in Denpasar. Side note Luxe hotel is down the street, I was told they have a beautiful wine selection, and killer eggs Benedict. We stayed 6 of us and felt very comfortable with the amount of space at banana, we could have stayed at any of the villas and felt comfortable. Watching the wind blow through the rice patties simply never gets old. Also Fresh Coconuts can be delivered daily.
title: Incredible Enriching Experience

owner_response.text:
We thank you for really embracing the Balinese culture and wanting to learn more. When you are ready to come back to Satori Villas with your family gathering of 28+, you will find lots of space for meetings, yoga classes, communal dinners, and special laughter.  Our cooks can prepare special meals and based on Vegan or Vegetarian cuisine if desired.
We are looking forward to your return in the New Year.  All the best to your sweet family, and we cannot wait to welcome you again!  All the best in the New Year!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Our stay at Satori Villas was wonderful! Transportation from the airport to the property was easily arranged and so appreciated after our long flight from CA. We were welcomed by staff who anticipated our every need. We needed to get money changed and a staff member was able to quickly motorbike to a nearby money changer. He knew of a place with the best rate and returned quickly with our money. Very fast, efficient and trustworthy staff! 

The food at Satori Villas is so fresh and yummy! Each morning we had a delicious breakfast outside on our serene patio overlooking the rice paddies. We enjoyed the atmosphere and food so much we arranged to have a dinner at the Villa one evening cooked in house! We created a plant-based menu to fit our group's specific dietary needs and I was so pleased to see the produce was washed with filtered water. Each meal we had was so well prepared and truly a delight!

We were also pleased with our short walk to the bustling streets of Ubud! Along the road to the downtown area are many shops, restaurants and spas that we visited throughout our stay. The walk is lovely. We enjoyed taking in all that the quiet local street had to offer as well as the bustling Ubud streets. 

Overall our experience at Satori Villas exceeded our expectations! We are planning a return very soon and can't wait to share the Villa Satori experience with more friends and family.
title: Serene and Delightful!

owner_response.text: Yours is a very satisfying review, and we are all very proud to have created such a memorable experience for you and your family!  The lovely Satori Villas staff are always on hand to provide intuitive yet never intrusive personal services, and to help in any way.  Our charming local street is the perfect stroll into town from the villas, with many shops, spas, galleries and restaurants to explore along the way.  Many of our local shops have better prices than Ubud market, and are far less crowded!  If you have bought too much to carry, just call on the provided cell phone - we are happy to come pick up you and your bags any time.  We anticipate your return soon and will welcome you back with open arms and a fresh mango smoothie!
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Beautiful villa. Nice breakfast, Friendly staff.

But, it's not a 10 minute walk from town in any stretch of imagination... AND walking is your only option!

Not suitable for young children, old people, special needs, or any kind of walking disability.

Here's the real tick: Not only does the location of this villa requires you to walk uphill on a steep narrow path (good luck when it's raining!) for about 7 minutes, but the owners of the villa think it's a great idea to make you walk another 10-15 to a parking lot far away. Completely unnecessarily as every other driver in town (that doesn't work for the villa), will take you to the bottom of the hill (where you 'just' need to climb up another 5-7 minutes). And remember, you'll do that when you first arrive, tired from your flight and drive, with your luggage. (They'll send someone to pick up the luggage on a scooter, but not you.)

So, don't believe the part about distance. If you're not planning on renting your own scooters for everyone in your group, bring your walking shoes!

They do offer to take you to the nearest starbucks (on the main road) on their scooter, but you can imagine the inconvenience every time if you're 6-8 people (normal in a 4 bedroom villa).

For some people, that's not a problem, but not divulging this information before accepting a booking? that's a serious problem!

To end on a good note, the staff are very friendly and make a real effort to help, there's a nice kitchen (as long as you do very light cooking... only 1 pot), there's a DVD player (but no movies), Cable (but HBO and such movies and series channels aren't subscribed to), and the breakfast is nice.
title: Beware of the details...

owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to review Satori Villas and for saying "Beautiful villa, nice breakfast, very friendly staff."  We take reviews very seriously, and as an opportunity to grow and be better today than we were yesterday.

In response to your points:  Our 3 full time are staff are available 24/7 to pick you up on scooters at the drop off point, whenever you call them on the Bali cell phone we provide.   When you and your family first arrived at the drop off point, you were asked if you would like a scooter ride to the villa before your bags were taken.  You declined.  It must have been a miscommunication, as it is mentioned several times as an option should you choose not to walk.  Many of our guests opt to walk, as it is such a beautiful walk (and at the start of the very popular Juwuk Manis Ricefields walk).  Our street is considered one of the most charming lanes in Ubud, lined with galleries, shops, spas and restaurants.  If there are 6 of you all wanting to go at the same time, some may need to wait 5 minutes while the others are given rides, as this is a part of Bali life everywhere. 
~There is definitely a sloping hill that goes to the rice fields on the way to the villa, and it is approximately 3 minutes uphill of the walk on the 2m wide path. You are rewarded with no cars, clean air, and authentic unhurried village atmosphere.  It is 10-12 minutes by stopwatch from the villa to Starbucks.  We have had guests in wheelchairs who were pushed up and slowly down the slope by our staff and they enjoyed it as "adventure".  We do say 'not recommended for those with mobility issues' in the extensive Welcome Notes that were sent to you.
~Most of our guests are families, and many have young children.
~The huge Western style gourmet kitchen is fully equipped with everything you could possibly want to cook with, including 7 pots and pans of all sizes, a blender, hand mixer, rice cooker, and an espresso machine. You must not have looked in all the cabinets.
~There is indeed a DVD player, and sitting right on top of it is a DVD holder with selection of 45 movies, and there are more in the drawer directly below.
~The large flat screen TV in the separate TV lounge has a satellite selection of 114 channels, and apologies your favorites were not among them.  

Again, we thank you for staying with us and hope you will have lovely memories of Bali.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: My partner and I stayed in the one bedroom villa.  Lovely QUIET villas set amongst the rice paddies, with NO CARS or 1000's of pedestrians passing. text: We had a really pleasurable stay at Satori (we had the 1 bedroom villa). The view from the balcony is breathtaking and I really recommend doing the rice paddy walk which is just outside the door! Staff were so attentive and pleasant and the villa itself was lovely. A generous breakfast is cooked for you in the morning for you to enjoy and they provide you with a phone to contact the staff which is really handy. The plunge pool was quite cold as it was shaded so you couldn’t really be in there for more than a couple of minutes (the only downside). We also got a bit lost trying to find the place in which we were later told there was a pickup service down in Ubud centre. We definitely did not mind the walk at all (our taxi got us all the way up to where he could) but we weren’t made aware of this service before our stay.

text:
I have just spent the most beautiful relaxing week with 6 of my girlfriends at Satori Villas. We hired Villa Banana and Villa Santana , there was a 5 minute walk between the 2 but very doable. We had many massages, facials etc in our villas , spent hours relaxing and chatting around the picturesque pool with view of the lush rice paddies. The villas are clean , beds comfortable and the staff excellent. Also the gardens are beautiful and well maintained.
Our days began with a cooked to order breakfast and we all felt very spoiled. Then our villa was cleaned and beds made. 
It is a 1.5 km walk into the centre of ubud , we enjoyed the walk but the offer of a lift on a motor scooter by the staff is always there. A couple of times we went shopping and called the manager on the cell phone he provided to organise someone to pick it up for us. There are some lovely walks through the rice paddies and numerous cafes bars and restaurants nearby if the walk into town was too daunting. Also , the local restaurant delivers if you want to eat in.
We all want to return with our families to Satori. I will remember this week fondly.
title: A week of bliss

text:
Just finished staying at Villa Satori for the 3rd time to in 3 years. We located this gem on trip advisor about 6 years ago but were unable to stay then due to them already being booked. 

When we decided to return to Bali in 201; we were able to get into Satori & since then there is no turning back. Satori & it’s staff are simply “our home away from home”!  There is nowhere else I would even staying. Yes, there are many options one can choose to stay, but the staff make this place so special. 

It’s disappointing to read a negative review  (sorry if I offend but not super surprised it’s by an American - likely no understanding of Bali & their practices & perhaps they are better suited for Hawaii) as anyone who knows the Balinese wools know they do not have a dishonest bone in their body. 

Please ignore the 2% & open your mind the the 98% who are giving truly honest reviews. If you stay at Satori you will not regret it & I guarantee you will leave a part of your heart behind.

text:
Why does the villa want my passport 2x (when they’ve already copied all from my party of 3 during check in) and the same credit card that I’ve already paid fully thru Orbitz?  

Well. I carried 2 credit cards with me but not the one they wanted that I used to pay Orbitz.  They demanded that I produce the card that I paid Orbitz with. 

When I asked, the response is to prevent fraud. 
What fraud when I’ve fully paid Orbiz months ago?  When I asked why do they need my passport 2x and the specific credit card, the response were:

1st) different management (ahhh... I was not informed of the villa being operated by multiple companies/management )

2nd) for the police

??????

Fraud??  Who’s at risk here of committing fraud here when Satori has copies of all 3 of our passports and my credit card info?  Me or Satori villa?
title: Accusations of fraud

owner_response.text:
NOBODY on our staff accused you of fraud. Clearly a misunderstanding. I, Arya, graciously explained everything to you today.

Once again, I apologize for the error we made taking you to the reservations office when this was not necessary for your reservation with Orbitz. As I explained to you, this is the first reservation we have received from Orbitz for our property and there was some confusion on the check in procedure.

Here are some facts for your reference:

1. It is the Banking Rules in Indonesia that we verify the credit card you used to remotely pay for your reservation. The same as if you purchase for an airline ticket on line, must present that card when you check in for your flight to verify the card. However in the case of an Orbitz reservation, this procedure is not necessary since Orbitz pays us for your reservation.

2. It is the obligation by Indonesian Law that every property in Bali registers every guest with the police. This requires each guests passport information. This is protection for the guests staying in Indonesia. Every hotel will require a copy of your passport.

We have built our business on integrity for eight years. Our business is creating a wonderful holiday experience for every guest arriving at Satori Villas Bali, as the majority of our reviews reflect. We are human, as are you, we made an error on your arrival by asking you twice to copy your passport and once to verify your credit card. 

We are all extremely disappointed that you are so harshly & inappropriately accusing me, our company & our lovely dedicated staff of fraud, when this was NOT the case at all, a baseless accusation. One error in asking you for your passport information twice leads you to believe we are fraudulent? We will move on to our mission to be better tomorrow than we were today, remaining focused on our passion to create exceptional experiences for all our Satori guests. Regards, Arya, Satori Villas Bali Manager
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Spent 4 nights in Villa Siri, absolutely loved it.  We had pre-booked transport from Sanur so were greeted by Wayan.  On arrival in Ubud we were then met by the staff from the Villa, Deshat, Boudi and I cannot remember the other young man, all very friendly and transferred us to the villa by scooter.  What scenery.  I was a little worried at first as the ride up seemed quite long and I thought the 10-15minute walk others had described might have been pushing it but my fears were allayed when we did the walk after arrival.  It is a little over 1km to the main street, there is a steep incline at one point but it is all in shade and if you go slow it is not a problem.  Breakfast was included and available any time from 7am.  The lovely Deshat cooked us up great omlettes and pancakes and the fruit smoothies were divine.  We did the rice terrace walk from the villa, so tranquil and what views. Had the pleasure of meeting Casey who made us very welcome.   We hope to return one day and would stay here again.
title: Stay here

I would surely recommend this place if you are ok with the walk and the geckos.The pool area is magical. The photographs on the website don't do justice to the place. The beauty is unreal.
title: Best hospitality

owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to positively share your Satori experience with the TripAdvisor community. We are pleased to know you enjoyed many elements of your stay with us and have clarified your personal issues with our property. Our mission is always to create wonderful memories for all our guests arriving at Satori. While our location is is something the majority of our guests love, we completely understand that it was not for you. Gekos are a part of the tropical natural ecology in Bali, harmless and feed on mosquitos, so we welcome them in our environment. I hope your onward travel throughout Bali gifted you with many moments of good times with your beautiful family. Lovely to have met you all, thank you for your kindness to all of us in the Satori Family. Warm regards, Ketut
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
This is a lovely villa. MOST BEAUTIFUL villa i have stayed in. But i will never recommend it, i am checking out in one night instead of three nights.
The location is very inconvenient.There are only two scooters available for drop to the centre according to the staff, but in all reality only one scooter was there.
The staff is extremely courteous and very welcoming but it is not worth the effort.
The villa is beautiful so is the pool area by the day. But at night, it is scary. There are many lizards inside and outside the villa. I counted four inside the villa and four in the patio.

It may be common in bali, but i for one, feel very uncomfortable.

Also, the crockery provided in the villa was dirty and covered in ants.
title: LOVELY place, but disappointed

owner_response.text:
You can't imagine how disappointed we are to read your review. I believe we did everything we possibly could to accommodate your discomforts. We are happy you say your "villa is the most beautiful you have ever stayed in" and that our "service is extremely courteous and very welcoming". These two comments are wonderful news to us. 

However lets make clear the following:

1. Our location is very clear on our properties website. Had you or your travel agent taken a moment to look at it, you will see our location is in a green zone in central Ubud. If a 10 minute walk to the center fo Ubud, or a 3 minute motor scooter ride from the center of Ubud is far away...so be it, each to their own. For most, this would be considered close. No where on any of our sites does our location information depict we are right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Ubud center, where you wanted to be.
2. Gekos are a part of tropical life, harmless and feed on mosquitos. If you want to enjoy a villa experience in Bali, 99% of the time you will encounter gekcos. Totally harmless and more afraid of you than you are of them. I have to say that geckos are a part of Bali and I doubt there is any where in Bali where you will not find them. Better gekos eating mosquitos than no gekos and being bitten by mosquitos.I have encountered gekos in many of the places I been in India, your home country, I was quite surprised your family was so frightened of them. 

As we explained to you when we met, most important to us is that our guests have a wonderful experience in Bali. I am personally disappointed that the majority of your discomforts are something we could do nothing about, our location & gekos, yet you give only two stars. I find that rating very harsh, given we found a solution that was extremely satisfying and accommodating to your needs and desires. We will continue on our mission to be better today than we were yesterday. Warm regards to you and your lovely family, Wishing you safe travels and many wonderful memories of good times together in Bali.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We stayed in Banana villa. The view is spectacular, the breakfast delicious, the staff really nice and the location perfect. One of my favorite hotel ever! I hope I could come back one day.

text: Satori Villas Bali is your ultimate home away from home. From the beautiful rice fields and delicious traditional Balinese breakfast, to Kasey and her heart-felt staff over-extending their hospitality, everything was truly magical. I went for a week by myself, and any doubts or fears I had traveling as a single woman was washed away once I was greeted by Satori Villas. The villa was spacious, clean, located in the heart of Ubud and walking distance to so many hidden gems. You're given a local phone to make calls during your stay, as well as call the staff for rides and any questions you may have during your stay. It was like I inherited a new family during my stay. I can't see myself returning to Bali and not staying at Satori Villas, they made my trip even more special :)

photos.caption: View from Villa Siri balcony. Breathtaking!

text: We stayed in Banana villa ( one of the villa of Satori villas). It's an awesome place. The villa had 3 rooms with attached toilets and bathroom and 1 room had toilet next to it. All the 3 rooms were spacious with view of swimming pool and rice fields. Only 1 room was relatively smaller with no great view. The kitchen is well stocked with food, cutlery and utensils if you plan to cook. Here are number of options we can select for breakfast and the cook and help were really fast in preparing and laying the breakfast. The villa is little inside and you have to walk for 10-15 mins to reach from Ubud central parking but it is amidst lovely rice fields and secluded from busy Ubud. You can't reach villa in a car or van. Only way to reach is by foot or bike. There is ample help from Satori villa to pick you up from Ubud central parking and also carry your bags. The location is great as you are just 15 mins away from the main Ubud market. We enjoyed staying in this place and will definitely come back again!!
title: Awesome place! Great stay!

text: We could see from the online photos that the Villas were very nice, but what we really didn’t understand until we arrived was how noisy and chaotic downtown Ubud is and how serene and peaceful the Satori Villas are.  It is a 15 minute walk from the Villas to the heart of the action but it is a world away.  It was so nice to come back to the Villas after a day of exploration and luxuriate in the villas (we stayed in two different ones), especially those private swimming pools.  At night the frogs serenaded us to sleep.  Some days we just stayed there and enjoyed watching the rice farmers and the birds that frequent the paddies.  If you don’t enjoy the walk like we did, the staff is always ready to give you a ride down the hill.  And the staff... very nice and helpful.  The driver, Gede, is helpful for day trips or airport runs.  We knew we would like Ubud, but didn’t realize the lodging would be the highlight.

text:
Desde donde poder explorar toda la isla porque su ubicacion esta en el centro. Ademas el tiempo es mucho mas agradable que en la costa.
El pueblo de Ubub es una inmersion en la vida de los balineses y sus artesanos
Las villas Satori son unas casas preciosas bien decoradas muy limpias y que tienen lo que tu puedas necesitar
Es cierto que no se llega en coche a la puerta de la casa pero no lo necesitas, las personas a cargo de cuidar las villas estan dispuestas a llevarte en moto en cualquier momento y a cualquier hora, creerme que esta siendo para mi una gran experiencia.
A cambio te duermes y amaneces con las vistas y los sonidos de los campos de arroz. Los sonidos por la noche son conciertos de la naturaleza que te acompañan mientras descansas
Estamos tomando masajes en la villa casi a diario y para ello nos pusieron dos mesas de masaje.
Tenemos servicio diario de desayuno con una carta muy variada a elegir cada dia ademas de zumos naturales, frutas variadas y todo lo que quieras pedir lo hacen realidad
Tambien hemos solicitado los servicios para que nos cocinaran en la villa de una seleccion de platos tipicos y la experiencia ha sido maravillosa. Las raciones tan abundantes que vamos a tener comida para varios dias.
Las camas son muy comodas con sabanas de algodon muy suaves.
La limpieza diaria es un plus porque al llegar de las excursiones no tienes que ocuparte de nada mas que de descansar
Si necesitas cambiar dinero, o quieres acercarte al pueblo para comprar, solo se lo comunicas por whappsap y en menos de dos minutos ya te responden
Caminar desde la villa hasta Ubud es un camino entre casas del pueblo que te puede llevar 10 minutos
El personal de la villa esta siempre atento a cualquier necesidad 24 horas
Ketut, este hombre es una maquina a toda hora atiende su whappsap para cualquier necesidad o consulta y nada es un problema y si lo es, El tiene la solucion.
Nos perdieron dos maletas y llegaron a la villa en dias diferentes, Ketut se ocupo de todo e includo durante un tour nos envio una foto de la maleta ya en la villa, todo un detalle.
Wayan es un gran mujer, rapida, lista y con una sonrisa balinesa a todas horas. Ella y la ayuda de Vera, hacen que nuestra estancia aqui sea un sueño , a mi me hace feliz verlas en la mañana ocupandose de la casa y los desayunos.
Son dos hormiguitas que estan pendientes de todo y ni las oyes y casi no las ves. Son de una discrepcion total.
Cuidan la casa con muchisimos adornos, con flores naturales que adornan todos los rincones de la casa, las habitaciones y los baños.
En cada rincon hay un trabajo bien hecho y con mucho mimo y cariño.
He estado anteriormente dos veces en Bali en hoteles de 5 estrellas y playa privada.
Esta experiencia esta siendo la mejor en Bali y la repetire con mis nietos.
Mi recomendacion es contratar un guia con chofer 65 euros al dia y ya tu estancia es Bali sera completa.
En la villa tienen chofer y guia de habla inglesa, un hombre extraordinario que nos recogio en el aeropuerto.
Nosotros elegimos un guia de habla española porque yo no me entiendo muy bien en ingles, por si os puede interesar

Dewa Budiana
+62 819 99255632
Guia en Bali español e ingles 

Gracias familia
Ketuk
Vera
Wayan

Me llevo a los tres en el corazon y les doy la enhorabuena por ser tan especiales, cuidar de nosotros durante este tiempo con tanta cortesia y mimo.
En verdad son la hospitalidad, la amabilidad y la sonrisa de Bali en estado puro.
Llevamos una semana aqui y todavia nos queda otra pero no he querido esperar a marcharme.
Se me quedan muchos detalles en el tintero y solo puedo decir
Ven a Bali
Ven a Ubud
Alojate en las villas Satori
Y habras entrado en el paraiso de tis vacaciones con un equipo humano que te cuidara y una villa con todas las comodidades.
No se puede pedir mas
Hasta siempre familia Balinesa
title: VEN A BALI a  disfrutar de esta villa en el paraiso de arrozales en Ubub y con un equipo de 4 personas que te cuidaran

text:
Die Bilder auf Booking.com (dort haben wir gebucht) spiegeln leider nicht das wieder wie wir unsere Villa vorgefunden haben. Das war etwas enttäuschend und daher hat es meine Erwartungen nicht erfüllt.

Die Kulisse und Umgebung ist sehr schön und vor allem voller Ruhe!

Das Personal war durchweg freundlich und professionell.

Die Lage ist sehr abgelegen und man kommt nur per etwas längerem Fußweg oder per Roller zu der Unterkunft. Man bekommt ein Handy zu Verfügung gestellt, wo man anrufen kann um dann vom Personal mit dem Roller gefahren zu werden. Der Service ist super - allerdings ist man wenn man keinen eigenen Roller hat immer auf diesen Service angewiesen.

Die Bettwäsche war leider nicht sehr sauber (hatte einige Flecken).

Im Vorfeld hatten wir einen Late Check Out angefragt (konnte uns noch nicht zugesagt werden wegen der unklaren Buchungslage an dem Tag). Bei Anreise teilte man uns mit, dass dies nicht möglich sei - völlig okay für uns. Etwas enttäuschend fand ich an der Angelegenheit, dass es keine andere Möglichkeit gab eine Dusche zu nehmen vor dem Rückflug (mehr wollten wir nicht). Hier war man leider nicht bemüht eine Lösung anzubieten oder zu finden.
title: Erwartungen wurden nicht erfüllt

text:
ウブドの王宮から歩いて10分程度の、田んぼの中にあるヴィラです。途中、急な坂がありますがビーサンでも登れる程度です。

車が入れない細いあぜ道沿いにありますので、ヴィラに連絡すると、バイクで迎えに来てくれます。

スタッフの方がみんなフレンドリーで最高です。
毎朝、スタッフの方が朝食を作りに来てくれます。頼めば、お昼も作ってくれるそうです。

周りにはいくつかのヴィラ、ワルン、コンビニなどがあります。
ウブドの王宮に行くまでに、お店やスパもあります。

暗くなると蛍がとびます。
近くにはあひるや牛、鶏が飼われていて、朝晩にぎやかですが、それもホッとする情景です。

また絶対に滞在したい場所の1つです。
title: とってもお勧めのヴィラ！
